inventory package

Subpackages

  • inventory.migrations package
    • Module contents

Submodules

inventory.filehandler module

inventory.filehandler.csv_to_device(filename, delimiter=',')

This function adds data from the given csv file to the database

Parameters

  • filename (str) – The filename of the csv to be imported

  • delimiter (char) – The seperator of the csv file. The default is ‘,’

inventory.filehandler.csv_to_xlsx(d_loc, d_name, d_name_xlsx)

This function converts a csv file to an Excel file (.xlsx) using the module pandas

Parameters

  • d_loc (str) – The directory where the file is located

  • d_name (str) – The filename of the csv file to be converted

  • d_name_xlsx – The filename of the xlsx file to be created

inventory.filehandler.handle_uploaded_file(f)

Handle the uploaded csv or Excel file. If it’s a csv send directly to csv_to_device else convert to csv first.

Parameters

f (Bytestream) – Uploaded File.

inventory.filehandler.xlsx_to_csv(d_loc, d_name, d_name_csv)

This function converts an Excel file to a csv file using the module pandas

Parameters

  • d_loc (str) – The directory where the file is located

  • d_name (str) – The filename of the xlsx file to be converted

  • d_name_csv – The filename of the csv file to be created

inventory.network_discovery_module module

network_discovery_module

This module is an example for a module that could extend the assetmanagement tool It collects data on assets in the network with the tools nmap and crackmapexec and sends this data to the filehandler in the form of a csv file

inventory.network_discovery_module.crackmapexec(scanning_range: str) → dict[str, dict[str, str]]

Discovers Assets with the command-line-tool crackmapexec and returns them in a Dict

Parameters

scanning_range – str IP Range of Network to be scanned

Returns

Discovered Data

Return type

dict[str, dict[str, str]]

inventory.network_discovery_module.data_combine(data_cme: object, data_nmap: object) → object

This Function combines the Dict Data from the Outputs of the CME and NMAP Scans to one complete Dict

Parameters

  • data_cme – CME data output by the cme function

  • data_nmap – Nmap data output by the nmap function

Returns

Data from the nmap scan combined with the additional data from cme

inventory.network_discovery_module.dict_to_csv(dict_data: object) → object

This function converts the used Dict Format to csv

Returns

CSV File containing data

inventory.network_discovery_module.network_discovery(scan_range: str) → object

This is the Function to call when a network discovery is wanted. It returns Data as CSV for further processing by the filehandler. It is an example of a module to expand the asset management DB and Webapp

Parameters

scan_range – str IP Range of Network to be scanned

Returns

CSV to be handled

inventory.network_discovery_module.nmap_discovery(scanning_range: str) → dict[str, dict[str, str]]

Discovers Assets with the command-line-tool nmap and returns them in a Dict

Parameters

scanning_range – str IP Range of Network to be scanned

Returns

Discovered Data

Return type

dict[str, dict[str, str]]
